patterns: I have a cough is that a symptom?
responses: The main symptoms of coronavirus (COVID-19) are a high temperature, a new, continuous cough and a loss or change to your sense of smell or taste. A full list of possible symptoms can be found here - who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019/question-and-answers-hub/q-a-detail/coronavirus-disease-covid-19
COVID-19 is the disease caused by a new coronavirus called SARS-CoV-2

patterns: Who is most at risk form covid-19
responses: People aged 60 years and over, and those with underlying medical problems like high blood pressure, heart and lung problems, diabetes, obesity or cancer, are at higher risk of developing serious illness. However, anyone can get sick with COVID-19 and become seriously ill or die at any age.

patterns: When do I have to self isolate
responses: If you have any symptoms of coronavirus (a high temperature, a new, continuous cough or a loss or change to your sense of smell or taste) If you have any of the sysmptoms for Coronavirus, or have been in contact resently with someone that has or may have the virus it is better you isolate at your home.

patterns: Can I travel to another country
Can I get support for my business
Can I still go to work
Do I still get paid if I dont go to work
responses: Depending on the tier you are in - depends on whether your business can remain open or not. Full details on  the restriction for different businesses can be found here - https://www.gov.uk/guidance/working-safely-during-coronavirus-covid-19?priority-taxon=774cee22-d896-44c1-a611-e3109cce8eae

A full checklist of what do to before, during and after travel can be found here - https://www.gov.uk/guidance/travel-advice-novel-coronavirus. You also need to check the country you are travelling to for their advice on quarantine on arrival.
All details of the support you can receive is detailed here - https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus/business-support
The latest update can be found here - https://www.gov.uk/guidance/national-lockdown-stay-at-home#going-to-school-college-and-university

Depending on your tier, depends if you can still go to work. To find out your tier and more details regarding this, please visit https://www.gov.uk/guidance/local-restriction-tiers-what-you-need-to-know?priority-taxon=774cee22-d896-44c1-a611-e3109cce8eae

You will receive statutory sick pay for the time you are off work and may also be eligible for test and trace support payment. Full details of the finical support available can be found here - https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-what-to-do-if-youre-employed-and-cannot-work
